title: Ticket #7402: Python bindings install doesn't see changes to CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX
description:
The cmake code that installs the python bindings invokes setuptools by wrapping and running a command like: python setup.py install --root=${CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX} --install-lib=${C_PYTHONARCHLIB} --install-scripts=${C_BIN}. This command string is parsed and coded into the resulting Makefile when cmake is run. This means that changes to any of the cmake variables (e.g. ${CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX}) after running cmake are not seen by setup.py.

Instead, we should "install" the scaffolding that setuptools generates to a well-known location at build time and then use cmake's normal install behavior to copy the scaffolding at install time, since the normal install behavior can understand changes to cmake variables.
